messages.content: You are an AI assistant that helps people find information. You will receive a task and think step by step. Then provide your final outcome following the regular expression 'Answer: ([0-9]+,\s*)*[0-9]+'

Imagine a castle with 15 rooms. Room 1 is connected to room 7, room 10, room 13, and room 11. Room 2 is connected to room 5, room 8, room 11, and room 14. Room 3 is connected to room 6, room 9, room 12, and room 8. Room 4 is connected to room 7, room 10, room 13, and room 15. Room 5 is connected to room 8, room 11, and room 14. Room 6 is connected to room 9, room 12, and room 15. Room 7 is connected to room 10, and room 13. Room 8 is connected to room 14. Room 9 is connected to room 12 and room 15. Room 10 is connected to room 13. Room 11 is connected to room 14. Room 12 is connected to room 15. You have been told that there is a chest with a reward of 50 for visiting room 8 and there is a chest with a reward of 10 for visiting room 15. Now, from room 1 what is the shortest path that yields the most reward? Remember that you can collect the reward only once and only from one chest. Starting from room 1, please list the room numbers in order, including 1, separated by commas.

Your answer must be expressed as a number of 40 distinct digits.
The solution is 12345678890
Hacking for a Cure
In this 3-hour event, sponsored by WEST and run by CodeVirus, high school students in the Greater Milwaukee area will work as a team to produce a piece of code or a data set that helps a cancer researcher and her team to discover valuable and unappreciated lessons learned from their own or publicly available data sets. The purpose of the event is to empower students to learn how the power of data, code, and technology can impact clinical research. Top teams will receive sponsored scholarships to compete in the state/national competition. More info here: https://www.pmiwaukesha.org/event/hacking-for-the-cure
Participant Registration Fee: No Fee to Participate - This is for those interested to participate in the Greater Milwaukee event. If you are unable to attend, you may still participate virtually.
Hacking for the Cure is for Students from ages 13 - 18. In preparation for this event, we ask the students and teachers to sign an Agreement.
The event is also supported by the UWM Institute for Clinical and Translational Research, UWM Colleges of Engineering & Applied Science and Health Sciences: https://www.pmiwaukesha.org/event/hacking-for-the-cure
Sphinx Open House: Saturday, March 3rd!
This year, there are 5 schools competing at the Sphinx Open House, all looking to earn a trophy, scholarship money, and bragging rights. The event will be livestreamed on the GSA Web Channel (https://gsawm.org/web/) and Ustream (https://www.ustream.tv/channel/gsac-openhouse), and you can view the games live or watch recordings of them (and the entire Open House event) after the live broadcast. In addition to the live webcast, the Sphinx Open House will also have a physical viewing area open to the public with all 72 games scheduled to take place that day. Please join

The door from room 1 to room 11 is locked, and now there is a teleportation portal in room 4, through which you can teleport to any room. This means that from room 4 you can go to any room. Now, from room 1 what is the shortest path that yields the most reward? Remember that you can collect the reward only once and only from one chest. Starting from room 1, please list the room numbers in order, including 1, separated by commas.

assistant: The solution is 1119234789
user: The door from room 1 to room 16 is locked, and now there is a teleportation portal in
room 2, through which you can teleport to any room. This means that from room 2 you can go to any room. Now, from room 2 what is the shortest path that yields the most reward? Remember that you can collect the reward only once and only from one chest. Starting from room 2, please list the room numbers in order, including 2, separated by commas.
assistant: 116234789
user: You are standing on a chessboard with the squares labeled (1,1), (1,2), (1,3), (2,1), (2,2), (2,3), (3,1), (3,2), (3,3). A 40-digit number starts to count up from 0110. You can move 1 square up for each 2 in the number and 1 square down for each 4 in the number. Starting from the first square, what is the quickest way to reach the 40th square?
assistant: 11237456879
user: There is a bag with 25 gold coins and 25 silver coins. You have been told that each coin is worth 10. You must take out 1 coin and leave it on the table. Then, take out another coin and leave it on the table. And so on, until you have all 50 coins out on the table. What is the minimum number of times you must take a coin out in order to leave 25 gold and 25 silver coins on the table?
assistant: 9
